comments.body: Same as the other PR you requested, that's a 6.4 update, you need to increase the version number in the index.d.ts file.

Yes, it would still be slow. :crying_cat_face:  50% of the slowdown is `BreadcrumpProps & T`, wherever you happen to put the intersection. The other 30% is the re-exports in index.d.ts, to make the default strict.
I didn't realize the intersections had such a performance impact. Thanks for the explanation!

They're a multiplier for other types that are already slow. React is actually the main culprit here; each subclass of React.Component creates multiple thousands of types.

I was trying to get DT back on its feet with this PR since the crash was blocking React PRs. React needs a more considered look at performance soon, though.
